name: places/ChIJ1RwDcRT3wokRLEg3bai5d5o
formattedAddress: 1311 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10033, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1311 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10033-7219, USA

originalText.text: I’ve bought from this store several times now and have had mostly positive experiences. However, last Friday there was some confusion over my credit card not being charged properly. The issue got resolved, but I had to watch what seemed to be a manger berate an employee right in front of me. It was extremely uncomfortable and unprofessional, I really feel bad for the employee as I’ve had to deal with abusive managers in past jobs myself. There’s no excuse for this, retrain your leadership please.

There’s no excuse for this, retrain your leadership please.

originalText.text:
A friend of mine ordered me a gift bottle delivery from this store for Christmas.  The bottle didn't arrive at the scheduled time.  Since the status of delivery was marked as ‘done’ I called the store to see if there was any confusion.  After repeated attempts to reach them, and being hung up on several times, I was finally told that they didn’t have any delivery people available.  I live in the neighborhood so I offered to pick it up.  The person on the phone agreed.  Next day I went to the store. All they had to do was give me the bottle which was already paid for.  Easy right?  Wrong.  Instead the owner became very abusive, didn’t listen to anything I tried to explain, insulted me and refused to give me the bottle.  Guess he doesn’t have a lot of Christmas spirit...
The store itself has a very mediocre selection, and their prices are definitely not cheap.  (I had time to walk around while I was waiting for the owner to speak to me).  Perhaps they make their money in some other way, since they clearly don’t care about selling liquor, or their customers.
Do yourself a favor and go to literally any of the nearby liquor stores: you will find better selection and better prices AND no one will yell at you.

originalText.text: I was celebrating my birthday and i went to get a Hennessy  VSOP 750ml   the cashier Carlos ask me for ID and when he notice that it was true he came out of nowhere and gave me a 200ml of the same kind of liquor free as a gift from the store i was in shock. It never happened to me ever in my life and i have been in a lot of liquor store not meaning that i m an alcoholic but it was very nice from them, thank you again. i highly recommend the store.

originalText.text: From day one the Owner & Staff have welcomed me with a smile, offer a comfortable and inviting atmosphere and they hold a conducive approach in building great relationships with their customers. I’m grateful to have them in my neighborhood & even more glad that they deliver with the same smile. Thank you for great service.

text.text: From day one the Owner & Staff have welcomed me with a smile, offer a comfortable and inviting atmosphere and they hold a conducive approach in building great relationships with their customers. I’m grateful to have them in my neighborhood & even more glad that they deliver with the same smile. Thank you for great service.

originalText.text: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. I placed an order for a box of Pinot Noir and a bottle of Evan Williams. After two and a half hours and a call to the store, we finally had the delivery driver arrive. When they handed over the delivery the wine was Pinot Grigio not Pinot Noir. I asked the delivery driver about this and his direct quote was "Well I'm not going to take it back, unless I'll just owe you a bottle the next time". Obviously we were not comfortable with this proposition. Therefore we placed a phone call to the store who responded abusively, claiming that we were lying. And that if we weren't lying then the delivery driver would have to be fired because of our complaint. We found this incredibly rude, incredibly disrespectful both to ourselves and their staff. At no point was there an attempt to remedy the situation, and we were left with a very sour experience.
